data.title: Wonder dinner again
data.text: Excellent food, wines, cocktails, desserts and atmosphere. Saturday night they have a young man playing  saxophone light jazz great addition to the overall experience. Food, service, and attention to detail is spot on here.  This is our third visit and is definitely one of our favorite places to head for a night out.

data.title: Relaxed and First Rate
data.text: Picasso's warm and relaxed atmosphere sets the stage when seeking a well prepared, plated and positively delicious dinner from a locally sourced menu. Our table of three enjoyed deviled eggs topped with pickled cucumber or crisp pork belly before tasting three different entrees, sea bass, salmon and wild mushroom pasta. We appreciated our server, Moody, for his knowledge of the menu as well as his attentive but not hovering style.  Serving sizes were not overwhelming yet allowed sharing among our table. Both fish types were cooked perfectly. Pasta was delivered steamy hot and al dente in the savory and rich sauce. Our meal was not rushed. Plates were removed in a timely manner. We felt welcomed and appreciated. We will definitely go back.

data.title: Never Again
data.text:
I went to V. Picasso for Sunday Brunch with 3 other adults and 1 child (who didn’t order food, so for all intents and purposes we were a four-top).  My wife and I are local and had been here at least 4 other times, including once for brunch. Our previous experiences here were positive. This visit, however, was so negative—and made worse by comments one of our party overheard the staff make about our table—that we will never be back. Here’s what happened:
 
We showed up at approximately 10:50 am.  There were a handful (maybe 5?) of occupied tables outside and maybe 3-4 occupied tables inside when we were seated.  It took approximately five minutes for our server to initially greet our table after we were seated.  We ordered drinks (coffee and water, apple juice for the child) and doughnuts before deciding on our main course.  The drinks came out in reasonable time and we then placed our entrée order (4 entrees, straight from the menu, no substitutions).  The doughnuts also came out in reasonable time and looked delicious, but upon cutting into them we discovered that they had not been sufficiently cooked through; much of the interior dough was raw and inedible.  We did our best to eat around the uncooked part and did not mention this to our server.
 
During this time, the restaurant had filled up somewhat but was nowhere near maximum capacity.  I would estimate that the dining room was halfway full.  As we waited for our entrees to come out, we began to notice that other tables that had ordered after us were getting food.  During this time, one member of our party requested a coffee refill.  This request went unfulfilled for several minutes even though other servers were walking around the dining room refilling other diners’ cups.  When our server finally made it back to our table and began pouring, it was immediately obvious that the coffee had not been properly brewed-it had the watery appearance of tea.  It took another few minutes to grab our server’s attention again and inform him that the coffee was off.  He seemed a bit rattled by this. He first took our coffee mugs to the server station, seeming unsure what to do next. Finally he took the mugs back to the kitchen and several more minutes elapsed before he came back with drinkable coffee.
 
We continued to wait for our entrees, at one point noticing that the party that had been seated immediately after our arrival had completed their meal and was leaving the restaurant.  At approximately 11:40, I asked our server if he knew when our food would be ready, as we’d been waiting for what seemed like an unreasonably long time.  He was clearly rattled at this point and said that several big parties had come in at the same time and the kitchen was backed up.  He assured us that our food was coming up immediately and then disappeared back to the kitchen.  Several minutes later, unable to locate our server, I asked another server if I could speak to the manager on duty.  I was told that acting manager was the head chef, who was in the kitchen and too busy cooking to speak with me.  I explained to this server that we’d been here for nearly an hour and planned to leave.  He kindly said he understood and let us know that we wouldn’t be charged for the drinks or doughnuts. We left at approximately 11:55.
 
We might have been able to cut the restaurant a break for the raw doughnuts, bad coffee and incredibly slow service, chalking it all up to one bad day. But then one of our party, who had excused himself to use the restroom while we talked to the server, overhead the staff in the kitchen talking about how unreasonable we were—something along the lines of “They’re complaining about how slow it is when the restaurant is full?!” There’s no excuse for that. The restaurant wasn’t full. We had been understanding FOR AN HOUR. If someone had communicated with us about whatever chaos was going on in the kitchen, or if the server had apologized for (as we suspect) neglecting to put in our order in a timely way or maybe even at all, we could easily have been persuaded to stay. But to be ignored and then insulted, well that’s too much. Never again.

data.title: consistently great
data.text: In my opinion, the relatively low ranking reflects local food preferences (trending towards chili fries and vast buckets of beer) rather than the quality of this establishment.  The setting is lovely and quiet.  The menu, while limited, is generally well executed.  The fried chicken is heavenly and not to be missed (although probably best shared - as it is enormous).  Solid wine and cocktail choices. Outstanding service. There are some misses (a lobster roll that is drenched in way too much butter, risotto that is far too gummy)- but overall your most consistent option for a nice dinner in Champaign.  Added benefit- it is attached to a lovely local store with amazing jewelry. Grab a glass of wine and go wonder at the artisanal pieces.

data.title: Brunch Visit
data.text: Great brunch food. We had the steak and eggs, chicken and waffles and eggs Benedict and all three were great. Also need to try the chocolate warm donut, it was so good and enough to share for three people. Price was very reasonable.

data.title: Not quite up to the prices it charges
data.text:
There is nothing wrong with V. Picasso's food. It serves adequate but uninspired high-end contemporary American food in a nice setting. Service is friendly and professional.
But you can do a lot better for the same price or in some cases quite a bit less, within a couple of blocks.

data.title: Early dinner
data.text: Stopped by and decided to give it a try   We are glad we did. The service was awesome and very accommodating changed the ingredients in the entrees and might our needs   Had the steak, duck and seafood pasta. All came out timely and perfect!!  Will be back

data.title: I really want to love this place
data.text: But I just don't....  Every time we go there (and we keep going back because I REALLY want to love it) I am disappointed.  The food is average, not spectacular, and spectacular is what I expect from a place like this.  When it comes to the service, it's hit or miss.  Just this week we went and had amazing service but the last time we were there the service was meh.  Overall I would say V. Picasso is just average and for the money you pay you can get better elsewhere.

data.title: Nice, but overpriced
data.text: We first ordered a prosecco and got warm white wine without gas. The answer: we just opened a new keg and it can come out a bit flat. Food was ok, the we added a glas of red. We got some pinot that for sure was not pinot and terrible. We only had two starters and the two beverages. Final check was 70 usd.

data.title: Excellent dinners outside in the sunshine!
data.text: Super pleasant dinner hour with very good food and a helpful attentive waiter. What a treat to be able to eat outside too!

data.title: Kind of Spanish, ish service
data.text: It was nice sitting outside-- but the food strives to be good-- not yet there.  Wine list is a fantasy in that nearly everything you order they don't have in stock.  Service is just ok-- waitress was not familiar with the wine list at all.

data.title: High Expectations that Fell Short
data.text:
We ate here over Valentine's day weekend, and to be fair- it was very busy. But as soon as we walked in, it was off to a bad start. The host seemed to have missplaced the reservation and then when we were seated- every server walked by us at least 5 times and we waited upwards of 25 minutes before we were even acknowledged. The good news is that the executive chef offered a bottle of champagne as compensation, although there was no apology from either the chef nor the server.

The menu is relatively limited, but impressive. It is certainly more refined than what you would normally find in a smaller Midwestern town, and is alike to an upper-class Chicago restaurant. 

The food itself was very hit or miss. The brussel sprouts lacked any flavor besides "fried." The aioli, although clearly homemade, lacked flavor and tasted similar to slightly sweetened mucous (and for the bacon aioli, it tasted like slightly sweet and salty mucous). It lacked acidity or any bright flavors (or any flavor at all, to be honest). 

The lamb was bland. There was a large lack of seasoning and the vegetables also put on the plate were clearly an afterthought and acted more as a garnish than something edible. The meat and cheese options for a homemade charcuterie were very basic and boring. When we went, there were also out of many plates/dishes, including some meats and cheeses from the meat/cheese menu and the grouper (which is what I wanted to order). This was in and of itself disappointing.

The saving grace was the loster ravioli, although I only got 4 pieces of ravioli. Call me American, but that still seems like a small portion. While limited, it was delicious. Again, clearly homemade but the balance of the dish was perfect and I was dipping bread in the leftover saurce. I absolutely recommend it. 

The atmosphere is good for a date, but know what you're getting into first. Yes, it has a fancy menu and it has fancy menu prices, but I think there are better "date night" options in town with better service and better flavors.

data.title: Feel free to come here if you want to spend more money on subpar food
data.text: We (my wife and I) have been here TWICE now and both times were disappointing. Regarding the most recent trip, the only things saving this place were the waitress and the cheese plate. Otherwise why would you come here to spend the same amount of money you could spend at other places for better food? Worse yet, why would you come here to spend money when you could get a MUCH better meal at other restaurants nearby for much less cash? If you are dying to eat here…please do now before they go out of business in the next 6-12 months.

data.title: WILL NOT RETURN
data.text: The first time we came here the food and service was perfect aside from the fact that our server reeked of cigarette smoke. My sister and I had brunch there again this am and it was less than pleasurable.  Alam was very polite and attentive.  The first thing that went wrong is my cocktail was not made as described the Paloma was supposed to come with a smoked rim and came with regular salt, it was not a very balanced cocktail as all I tasted was tequila.  The next thing that went wrong is my sisters food was completely wrong.  She ordered the bacon and sausage inlet and received a steak, onion and zucchini omelet.  When her correct omelet came out Eric Moody (who is very moody by the way and was our first server that smell of smoke) presented as the "bacon" omelet so she asked if there was sausage as well because Thats what the menu said and he proceeded to argue with her about what their computer screen said that it is just a bacon omelet so she asked again if it had sausage and he said yes but that's not what the computer screens says.  After cutting into the omelet the inside was nothing but raw egg so she sent it back.  No manager ever came to speak with us, however Alam was very apologetic and took the food off of the bill.  Needless to say WE WILL NOT BE RETURNING!

data.title: Unique amazing food, perfect service
data.text: Venison Osso bucco that was perfect, excellent attention to food allergies, pretty inside.  Friendly staff.

data.title: Came for wedding ring, left with brunch
data.text:
Went to Christopher Jewelry today to figure out my wedding band. The store opens into V. Picasso. The design is lots of barn wood and other wood features. There are heavy castle type doors throughout. If you think the decor is awesome...well then the bathroom will blow you away. Can't even describe it. Classy and luxurious but not over the top. 

Ok, so what about the food and service??? Well our server was very nice. The food came out fast. Had the V Breakfast. 2 eggs, bacon, hash browns and half biscuit. The ingredients were fresh and local. The preparation and presentation was definitely hipster cheque. My daughter ordered a side of bacon...it was interwoven. Very yummy. 

They finished up their meals while i went in for a consult on my custom wedding band. They were able to hang out while I did my business in the jewelry shop. 

Family friendly on weekends and I can only imagine how fun in the early and later evening.

data.title: Romantic Interior, Creative Menu
data.text: We have been here 4 times now so I wanted to leave feedback on the pros and cons of this restaurant. First of all the building it's self is well done and charming right down to the "Bevelo" real gas lights out in front (these are the copper lights handmade by a small company in New Orleans who supplies the French Quarter with their lights. They are also available in electric models l put on my own house. The bar is nice and a great place to stop in for a glass of wine or drink before a movie or event at the Virginia. The dinner menu is creative but the results are not always consistent. I am not sure what is going on in the kitchen but maybe they have had changes in the staff. It might be better if they had a few more simple items on the menu done well. Over all we like this place and will continue to come here.

data.title: Atmosphere is lively but!!!!!
data.text:
The building when you walk in is unique very quaint very loud because the space is a bit small when you want to sit at the bar not many stools only a couple of tables and couches that you sit with other people
We had drinks which were normal bar drinks we looked at the menu while we were waiting we decided that the kind of food on the menu wasntthe kind of food we were expecting there I think we were expecting steak and some other kind of comfort food but it was on the farm food like wild game and such so we just stayed for a cocktail.

data.title: Nice atmosphere but food didn't live up
data.text:
Went to V Picasso last night for date night. He ambiance and service were great but the food was blah.  Started with a deviled egg with lamb sausage that was okay but over fried. Cheese plate to start was also nice. Entrees were just okay: I had venison osso buco and it was not as tender as it could have been, wife has pork and it too was lacking. We skipped on dessert but were disappointed overall. 

On a positive note, say Nandos opened nearby and will be trying it next.

data.title: Venison at a restaurant? Yes!
data.text:
What a great dining experience. We had walked past this newer restaurant several times in the past few months and decided to try it out after taking a look at the menu. I saw Venison. I love venison. I have never seen venison at a restaurant and was curious.

Making an online reservation was a piece of cake. Their website is quite good. We showed up and they had a table immediately ready for us.

In lieu of a lot of verbiage I will just say every part of the experience was top notch (service, wine/drink selection, ambiance, decoration) and get into the interesting part which is ordering venison in a restaurant.

Growing up in a farming/hunting based community I have had my fair share of deer meat and love it. It can also be scary because it can taste quite gamy. I had these fears mixed in with the curiosity. This was no old-buck venison though. I had a butter knife and didn't need anything else as it was that tender. Flavor of the meat mixed with the potatoes, pearl onions, and rest of the course melded together into the best meal I have had in a long while. Best meal I have had in the area outside of Gibson City. This place is certainly going to easily go punch-for-punch with the local favorites (Radio, Destihl, Bacaro, The Alley).

After sharing these thoughts with our wonderful waiter, and getting an amazing french press irish coffee to finish up the meal the head chef and sous chef came out to talk to me about the meal, the farm in Wisconsin? where they get this wonderful stuff, the local farm that they have a partnership with for everything they can locally source.

Little pricey for the area, but well worth it for what you get despite.

6/5 if I could. Would (and will) do again.
